Thanks @Remilito for the improvement. LGTM

Tested and it fixes the problem.

However, since the change #2092, visualization is re-created everytime when switching. I'd suggest find a way restore `ng-show` and address problem ZEPPELIN-2148 in different way. So we can leverage activate() deactivate() function. Otherwise it is bit annoying especially with visualization that takes long time to create/initialize.
How about make Zeppelin skip install npm and node.js when no visualization/spell is enabled?

That would be amazing. :)
--

Hi @FRosner. Thanks for contribution.

- Zeppelin build system relies on travis. So please setup your travis account and travis project for Zeppelin.

- Usually, it would be good to fill PR description so that reviewers can understand your PR :)
Will do 👍. I marked it as WIP, as I was filling it. I just created it already to show that I am working on it.

I'v just changed this PR to **WIP**

Here are some features, improvements which can be done in this PR. I will resolve them and comment soon. 

- refine `transform()` return value
- selectable dynamic parameter. `{ ..., name: "theme" paramType: "optional", options: ["light", "dark"]`
- support multiple chart types in one visualization. `{ subcharts: ["area", "stacked", "stream"] }`
- customized axis spec + dynamic parameters for each sub chart type.
- parse dynamic parameters based on types (`string`, `number`, `JSON`)
- adjusting axis automatically

@1ambda I enabled Travis for my repo. All builds passed except [this one](https://travis-ci.org/randerzander/zeppelin/jobs/209828896) which unrelated errors about Pig/MapReduce.
Seems overcomplicated for `HDFSNotebookRepo` to extend `VFSNotebookRepo`, and to be synchronizing the local FS with the remote FS.   Just implement `NotebookRepo` directly.

@randerzander Hi, it's flaky test. You can restart the failed job again using the `restart` button.
If you close / open this PR after all jobs pass, you can see this

- It's not mandatory to pass all tests to be reviewed. But some reviewers might select PRs first which pass all tests.

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/4968473/23819824/462fcefa-064f-11e7-8c37-007d845b925b.png)

Looks good! Regarding `%`,  if the percentage means nothing, then it's okay with not showing it i think.

As per [ZEPPELIN-2237](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ZEPPELIN-2237), in situations in which data is grouped, the pie chart only displays the data from first group. With this fix, data from all the groups would be displayed in the pie chart

## Discuss
I would prefer to see pie chart with broken slices: https://www.amcharts.com/demos/pie-chart-broken-slices/. Not sure if nvd3 supports this feature. I won't suggest bringing in a new charting library to implement such an idea. Thoughts...

While I was working on this issue, I came across: another one [ZEPPELIN-2253](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ZEPPELIN-2253), pie chart rendering issue when column selected as 'key' is changed
Thanks a lot!

does progress value needs to be clear when canceled or job failed?

I can not add it into system test because livy 0.4 is not released yet, and no snapshot artifact deployment for livy. I can do that after livy 0.4 is released

> does progress value needs to be clear when canceled or job failed?

The finally block would already been executed no matter it is succeeded/canceled/failed.
and progress value would not show in frontend when it is canceled/failed, this behavior should be the same for all interpreters.

Property NameValue
default.driverorg.postgresql.Driver
mysql.urljdbc:mysql://localhost:3306/
mysql.precodeset @v=12
+ +##### Usage +```sql +%jdbc(mysql) +select @v <-- can we say here we get in return v, which is set in the precode ```
